instructions.title: How To Delete or Deactivate Your Pinterest Account
instructions.before: There are two options if you no longer want your Pinterest Account.  You can either temporarily disable your account, or you can permanently delete it.  Both options follow the same steps, except at the end you either choose deactivate or delete.
instructions.after: Remember, both Deactivation and Deletion will remove everything on Pinterest from the Public Eye.
thingsToRemember: When you deactivate your Account, your profile and boards won't be visible on Pinterest anymore.  Pinterest will also unlink your Facebook and Twitter accounts, if you're connected to them.
You can go to your old profile URL to make sure that your account's no longer live, ex: pinterest.com/USERNAME
Don't log in to confirm that it's deactivated—logging in will reactivate your account.
It will take 14 days for your account to be permanently closed (f you change your mind before 14 days, log in with email and password and Pinterest will send you a link to reactivate account).

After Deactivation, you can reactivate your Pinterest account whenever you want by logging in with your username and password. But you still have  to confirm reactivation by clicking the reactivation email on your email address.

steps: [Go to the Pinterest Website](https://www.pinterest.com). If you're already logged in, doing so will open your Pinterest home page
Open the 3 dots in the top right corner and Click Edit Settings
Click Account Basics and Scroll Down
Select the Reason you would like to Deactivate or Delete
Here you can either Click Deactivate my Account Or you can Click Permanently Close my Account

qnAnswers.question: What happens when I deactivate my account?
qnAnswers.answer: When you deactivate your Account, your profile and boards won't be visible on Pinterest anymore.  Pinterest will also unlink your Facebook and Twitter accounts, if you're connected to them.

qnAnswers.question: What happens when I delete my account?
qnAnswers.answer: It will take 14 days for your account to be permanently closed (f you change your mind before 14 days, log in with email and password and Pinterest will send you a link to reactivate account).

qnAnswers.question: How can I make sure that my account is no longer active?
qnAnswers.answer: You can go to your old profile URL to make sure that your account's no longer live, ex: pinterest.com/USERNAME.  Don't log in to confirm that it's deactivated—logging in will reactivate your account.
